newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - August 21.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - August 21.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Wednesday:

** While the Federal Reserve's Federal Open Market Committee left interest rates unchanged at its meeting Tuesday, the odds of monetary tightening are likely to mount as 1996 comes to a close, analysts said.
** The Dow Jones industrial average closed up 21.82 points at 5,721.26 on Tuesday after the Federal Reserve held interest rates steady.

** Jakarta share prices closed marginally higher on Tuesday due to active buying in secondaries and selected heavyweights. The Jakarta composite index rose 2.53 points, or 0.47 percent, to 539.61 points.
** On Wednesday, the Indonesian rupiah was at 2,342.00/42.50 in early trading against an opening of 2,341.75/42.25.
** Bank Lippo following announcement of a rise in its 1996 first six months net profit.
** Textile firm Pan Brothers Tex on last Friday's announcement of a tender offer.
** Property firms Duta Anggada, Dharmala Intiland and Bhuwanatala on talk of possible higher earnings following the lowering of interest rates by some large banks.
** Shipping firm Berlian Laju Tanker on expected government regulations on shipping likely to be issued in the near future which could boost earnings of shipping firms.
** Lippo Securities on talk of a possible rights issue.
